channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: German inflation posts surprise drop to 2% in August
item.description: The harmonzied German consumer price index eased to 2% in August, the statistics office Destatis said Thursday.

item.title: Nvidia shares fall despite earnings beating estimates
item.description: Nvidia shares fell on Thursday despite its fiscal second-quarter results beating estimates.

item.title: Uber takes stake in SoftBank-backed self-driving tech startup Wayve
item.description: Uber and British artificial intelligence startup Wayve announced a partnership Thursday that will see the two collaborate on autonomous driving technology.

item.title: UN nuclear watchdog chief pushes back on Moscow’s calls for objectivity after Kursk plant visit
item.description: Russia accused Ukraine of attempting a drone strike at the Kursk nuclear plant during a lightning cross-border incursion under way since early August.

item.title: ‘Vigorous give and take’: U.S. security advisor discusses economic curbs in rare trip to China
item.description: U.S. national security advisor Jake Sullivan said he raised concerns about the country's focus on economic security in meetings with Chinese officials.

item.title: Delivery Hero shares pop 10% as European food delivery giant plans IPO of Middle East unit
item.description: Delivery Hero CEO Niklas Ostberg said the IPO of its Middle East business was about bringing in local investors in the region to co-invest and support the unit.

item.title: Slowdown in Nvidia's sales growth spooks chip stocks in U.S. and Asia
item.description: Losses were most pronounced in Nvidia's direct suppliers, such as TSMC and SK Hynix

item.title: These Asian firms in Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway portfolio have surged, with one soaring 30%
item.description: Berkshire hit a $1 trillion market capitalization on Wednesday, the first non-technology company in the U.S. to hit the milestone.

item.title: Nokia phone maker launches Barbie handset for $130 — with no internet
item.description: HMD, the company behind Nokia-branded phones, launched a Barbie-branded phone Wednesday that comes with calls and texts — but no internet.

item.title: You have a right to ignore your bosses — but only in these countries, and after work hours
item.description: Australia has joined the list of countries that allow employees the "right to disconnect" from work.

item.title: Dollar General shares crater 25% as retailer cuts outlook, blaming 'financially constrained' customers
item.description: The discount retailer slashed its guidance for full-year same-store sales and profit.

item.title: CrowdStrike beats quarterly consensus but lowers full-year guidance
item.description: CrowdStrike expects less revenue for the full fiscal year following a broad-based outage on July 19 stemming from a buggy software update.

item.title: Japan's next prime minister could be the youngest candidate in a crowded election for party leadership
item.description: Shinjiro Koizumi surfed and ate sashimi in Fukushima to quell water safety concerns. He was also the first sitting cabinet minister to take paternity leave.

item.title: Nvidia's earnings report shows the problem of being priced for perfection
item.description: Nvidia topped Wall Street estimates across the board in its earnings report on Wednesday, though its gross margin showed slight slippage.

item.title: Best Buy shares surge on profit beat and guidance hike
item.description: Best Buy now expects to see full-year adjusted earnings per share in the range of $6.10 to $6.35, up from a prior range of $5.75 to $6.20.

item.title: Finland will soon bury nuclear waste in a geological tomb that’s built to last for 100,000 years
item.description: The pioneering project has been hailed as both a watershed moment for the long-term sustainability of nuclear energy and "a model for the entire world."

item.title: Telegram CEO charged with allowing criminal activity by French prosecutors
item.description: French prosecutors on Tuesday charged Telegram CEO Pavel Durov with enabling criminal activity on the messaging platform.

item.title: Nvidia reports 122% revenue growth on surging demand for data center chips
item.description: Nvidia reported second fiscal-quarter earnings Wednesday after the bell.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Nvidia beating expectations isn’t enough
item.description: Is it fair to say Nvidia beat expectations, if retail investors always expect that the company will exceed expectations?

item.title: China's electric car race is becoming more about chip prowess as companies focus on tech
item.description: Price wars aside, Chinese electric car companies are now competing on driver-assist and other tech powered by semiconductors.

item.title: Biden and Xi to speak after rare U.S. security advisor trip to China
item.description: The announcement came amid U.S. national security advisor Jake Sullivan's trip to Beijing this week to meet with Wang Yi, China's top diplomat.

item.title: U.S. government researchers visit a Korean mine as the race against China for critical minerals heats up
item.description: The Sangdong Mine, owned by a subsidiary of Canada-based Almonty Industries, is set to resume operations this year.

item.title: OpenAI in talks to raise funding that would value it at more than $100 billion
item.description: OpenAI is in talks to raise a funding round that would value the artificial intelligence startup at more than $100 billion, CNBC has learned.

item.title: Nvidia announces $50 billion stock buyback
item.description: Nvidia said Wednesday that its board of directors has approved a $50 billion stock buyback.

item.title: Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway hits $1 trillion market value, first U.S. company outside of tech to do so
item.description: The milestone came two days before Buffett's 94th birthday.

item.title: Google to relaunch tool for creating AI-generated images of people after pulling service due to inaccuracies
item.description: Google's Imagen 3 will allow Gemini users to create AI photos of people in the coming days.

item.title: Super Micro shares fall 19% on filing delay, Hindenburg Research report
item.description: Shares of Super Micro fell after the company announced it will not file its annual report for the fiscal year on time.

item.title: Affirm shares surge 16% after better-than-expected results, strong guidance
item.description: Affirm shares jumped Wednesday in after-hours trading following a beat on the top and bottom lines.

item.title: Libya’s power divisions could once more fracture its oil output – as markets question for how long
item.description: A tussle over the Libyan central bank's leadership has led the country's eastern administration to declare the shutdown of key oilfields.

item.title: This high-income region has the least active people globally, WHO report shows
item.description: About 1.8 billion people did not meet their recommended levels of physical activity in 2022, according to a report by the World Health Organization.
